data_clean module¶

class data_clean.Data_Clean(df)¶

Bases: object

This class allows manipulating pandas dataframes to format data appropriately for analysis.

cat_ohe()¶

All categorical variables will be one-hot encoded. Useful for neural networks.

Returns

None

convert_vartypes(num_to_cat_cutoff=0)¶

Modifies the data frame fed into DATA_CLEAN and converts variable types to the appropriate type needed for further analysis.

Parameters

num_to_cat_cutoff (int) – Optional; default is 0. Will force a numeric variable to be categorical if the frequency of values is below the cutoff. If zero, no numeric variables will be converted to categorical.

Returns

None

date_col_as_index(date_col)¶

Converts the date column specified in the function into a date and turns it into an index for the pandas data frame.

Parameters

date_col (date) – Required; no default given Column to be made into the index. Will be converted to datetype if not already in that form.

Returns

None

na_cutoff(na_cutoff_percent=0.3)¶

Observes all columns in the data frame and removes those with missing values higher than the parameter specified.

Parameters

na_cutoff_percent (float) – Optional; default .3 Will force variables with NA values higher than this percentage to be removed from the dataset.

Returns

None

outliers()¶

Uses Tukey’s Method to identify potential outliers in dataset.

Returns

data frame of probable outliers, data frame of possible outliers.

plot_catvars()¶

Plots categorical variables in bar plot for quick and dirty EDA analysis.

Returns

pandas barplot object

plot_numvars()¶

Plots numeric variables in histogram for quick and dirty EDA analysis.

Returns

pandas histogram object

reduce_levels(level_cutoff_percent=0.01, other_name='Other')¶

Modifies the data frame fed into the DATA_ClEAN class to reduce the levels of infrequently occurring categorical variables.

Parameters

  • level_cutoff_percent (float) – Optional; defaults to .01 Will force categorical levels with a frequency below this percent to be labeled “Other”.

  • other_name (str) – Optional; defaults to “Other” The name to give the infrequent levels of a categorical variable.

Returns

None
